speech:
Identify Your Stress: 
Understand whatâ€™s causing your stress. Once you identify the source, you can work on addressing it.

Avoid Caffeine and Alcohol:
 These substances can increase stress levels and trigger overeating.

Write It Out: 
Writing about your feelings can help you understand them better and reduce stress.

Use Scent: 
Certain scents, like lavender or chamomile, can have a calming effect and help manage stress.

Talk to Someone: 
Sharing your feelings with a trusted friend or family member can provide emotional support.

Positive Affirmations:
 Encourage yourself with positive and uplifting statements. This can improve your mood and reduce the desire to stress eat.

Exercise: 
Regular physical activity can help reduce stress levels and improve your mood, which can help manage overeating.

Eat Healthy Foods:
 A balanced diet can contribute to overall mental well-being and can help manage overeating.

Practice Mindfulness: 
Techniques such as deep breathing, meditation, and yoga can help you stay present and focused, reducing stress and helping manage overeating.

Seek Professional Help:
 If your stress eating is causing significant distress or interfering with your life, consider seeking help from a mental health professional.
